duties_responsibilities.duty: Support and participate in the design and development of the geospatial database.
Oversee data flow, management, and distribution activities to support GIS access and use within the organization.
Maintain up-to-date and accurate geospatial documentation for reference.
Develop GIS-related software applications and provide complex analysis on modeled GIS data.
Conduct spatial analysis, including overlay operations, proximity analysis, and spatial modeling.
Research, compile data, and create maps and/or web applications to present geospatial data.
Provide support for emergency or high-priority programming or data analysis utilizing GIS software and statistical techniques to derive insights.
Recommend and establish standards and procedures for the production of high-priority GIS data, reports, interactive maps, and associated services.
Design and develop integrations with other operational systems and data to produce maps, web applications, and dashboards for presenting data findings and derive insights.
Write programs and develop user interfaces, menus, and macro-level commands to meet high-priority GIS needs.
Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and security protocol to protect sensitive data.
Engage in a variety of projects requested by a range of clients to support GIS needs.
Front-level response for emergency or high-priority programming or data forensic analysis.
Develop and maintain the GIS computing infrastructure.
Research, develop, and recommend technology, price, schedule, and other elements to meet specific customer needs relating to geospatial data.
Train users and programmers to ensure maintenance, usage, and application are appropriate.
Work with clients to determine GIS needs and architectural considerations to assist in defining the scope of work.
Document research and development work while providing timely reporting of project status.
Perform other duties as requested or assigned.
